item.title: 黑帮以加密货币财富为目标，女子逃脱巴黎拙劣绑架案
item.description: 一个蒙面团伙企图在巴黎绑架一名加密货币商人的女儿，这是近几个月来针对加密货币富豪及其家人的至少第三起暴力袭击事件，法国检察官正在对此展开调查。【原文：French prosecutors are investigating after a masked gang attempted to kidnap the daughter of a crypto businessman in Paris in what is at least the third violent attack targeting wealthy crypto players and their families in recent months.】

item.title: 古巴食糖产量进一步下降，令朗姆酒制造商感到不安
item.description: 据最近的官方报告和一位业内人士称，古巴的原糖年产量将在 2025 年降至 20 万吨以下，这是自 19 世纪以来的第一次，可能会导致朗姆酒制造商缺少一种关键原料。【原文：Cuban annual raw sugar production will fall below 200,000 metric tons in 2025 for the first time since the 19th century, potentially leaving rum makers short of a key ingredient, according to recent official reports and an industry source.】

item.title: 诺和诺德与 Septerna 达成 22 亿美元协议，开发肥胖症新疗法
item.description: 诺和诺德公司（Novo Nordisk）周三表示，该公司已与美国生物技术公司Septerna达成了一项合作与许可协议，共同开发治疗肥胖症、2型糖尿病和其他心血管代谢疾病的口服小分子药物，Septerna公司的价值可达22亿美元。【原文：Novo Nordisk has struck a collaboration and licensing deal with U.S. biotech Septerna to develop oral small molecule medicines for obesity, type 2 diabetes and other cardio-metabolic diseases that could be worth up to $2.2 billion for Septerna, they said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 人工智能基础设施公司 TensorWave 最新融资 1 亿美元
item.description: 总部位于拉斯维加斯的初创公司 TensorWave 周三宣布，该公司在最新一轮融资中获得了 1 亿美元的资金，旨在利用迅速扩大的人工智能基础设施市场。【原文：TensorWave, a Las Vegas-based startup, announced on Wednesday that it has secured $100 million in the latest funding round, as it aims to capitalize on the rapidly expanding AI infrastructure market.】

item.title: 钢铁制造商纽柯在网络安全事件后停止部分生产
item.description: 钢铁制造商纽柯公司（Nucor）周三表示，在发现一起涉及第三方未经授权访问其使用的某些信息技术系统的网络安全事件后，该公司已停止了多个地点的某些生产。【原文：Steelmaker Nucor said on Wednesday it had halted certain production at various locations after identifying a cyber security incident that involved unauthorized third-party access to certain information technology systems it used.】

item.title: 消费者反弹加剧，小米电动车在华新订单下滑
item.description: 分析师周三表示，中国小米公司的 SU7 电动轿车新订单量正在下滑，该公司及其魅力四射的首席执行官正在努力应对日益增长的消费者反弹，这种反弹目前已威胁到其一飞冲天的销售业绩。【原文：China's Xiaomi is seeing a slump in new orders for its SU7 electric sedan, analysts said on Wednesday, as the company and its charismatic CEO grapple with a growing consumer backlash that now threatens its runaway sales success.】

item.title: 晨间活动："壮丽 7 号 "骑行回城
item.description: 阿曼达-库珀（Amanda Cooper）撰写的《当今美国和全球市场的重要事件》。【原文：What matters in U.S. and global markets today by Amanda Cooper.】

item.title: 美联储古尔斯比：美联储等待了解关税影响，数据仍显嘈杂
item.description: 芝加哥联储主席奥斯坦-古尔斯比（Austan Goolsbee）周三表示，数据显示4月份消费者通胀温和并不一定反映出美国进口关税上升的影响，美联储仍需要更多数据来判断物价和经济的走向。【原文：Data showing temperate consumer inflation in April does not necessarily reflect the impact of rising U.S. import tariffs, with the Federal Reserve still needing more data to discern the direction of prices and the economy, Chicago Fed President Austan Goolsbee said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 特斯拉之后，更多的大公司提议投票 "Dexit "离开特拉华州
item.description: 路透社发现，在未来几周内，九家上市公司的投资者将就放弃将特拉华州作为公司注册地的提案进行投票，每家公司至少价值 10 亿美元，这可能会损害该州长期以来作为美国企业之都的声誉。【原文：In the coming weeks, investors in nine public companies worth at least $1 billion each will vote on proposals to ditch Delaware as their place of incorporation, potentially denting the state's longtime reputation as Corporate America's capital, Reuters has found.】

item.title: 高盛称投资者削减美元持有量，对美国恢复中性立场
item.description: 高盛集团总裁约翰-沃尔德伦（John Waldron）说，最近投资者对美元资产的减持表明，他们对该货币的立场已恢复到更加中性，而不是全面 "冲关"。【原文：Goldman Sachs President John Waldron said a recent lightening up of U.S. dollar assets by investors had shown them returning to more neutral positions on the currency, rather than a wholesale "run for the gates."】

item.title: 据《华尔街日报》报道，Databricks 将以 10 亿美元收购初创公司 Neon
item.description: 据《华尔街日报》周三报道，Databricks 已同意收购数据库初创公司 Neon，交易价值约为 10 亿美元，这家数据分析公司的目标是加强其在人工智能驱动的数据管理方面的能力。【原文：Databricks has agreed to buy database startup Neon in a deal valued at about $1 billion, the Wall Street Journal reported on Wednesday, as the data analytics company aims to bolster its capabilities in artificial intelligence-powered data management.】

item.title: 印度批准海鑫-富士康合资半导体公司成立
item.description: 印度信息部长 Ashwini Vaishnaw 表示，印度内阁周三批准了由 HCL Technologies 和富士康合资的一家新半导体企业，该企业将位于北方邦，耗资 370.6 亿卢比（约合 4.3472 亿美元）。【原文：India's cabinet on Wednesday approved a new semiconductor unit, a joint venture between HCL Technologies and Foxconn , costing 37.06 billion rupees ($434.72 million) and to be located in the northern state of Uttar Pradesh, information minister Ashwini Vaishnaw said.】

item.title: Alphabet 旗下 Waymo 在与道路障碍物相撞后召回 1200 多辆汽车
item.description: Alphabet 旗下的自动驾驶部门 Waymo 周三表示，由于车辆检测或应对物体的方式存在故障，一些汽车与道路障碍物相撞，该公司将召回 1212 辆汽车。【原文：Alphabet's self-driving unit, Waymo, is recalling 1,212 vehicles after some cars collided with roadway barriers due to a fault in how the vehicle detected or responded to the objects, the company said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 戴姆勒卡车公司预计第二季度北美订单量与第一季度基本持平
item.description: 全球最大的卡车制造商之一戴姆勒卡车公司（Daimler Truck）周三告诉分析师，其北美卡车部门第二季度的订单量将与第一季度大致持平。【原文：Daimler Truck , one of the world's biggest truckmakers, told analysts on Wednesday that second-quarter orders in its Trucks North America segment will be roughly on par with the first quarter levels.】

item.title: 福特将召回超过 27.3 万辆汽车
item.description: 美国国家公路交通安全管理局周三表示，由于制动液泄漏可能导致制动功能丧失，福特汽车公司将在美国召回 273,789 辆汽车。【原文：Ford Motor is recalling 273,789 vehicles in the United States as a brake fluid leak may cause loss of brake function, the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 本周开局出色，美股期货表现平平，贸易发展受关注
item.description: 周三，美国股指期货持平，本周开局表现强劲，通胀数据疲软和中美贸易休战提振了市场情绪，目前市场关注更多贸易协议的进展。【原文：U.S. stock index futures were flat on Wednesday, following a strong start to the week when a soft inflation reading and a U.S.-China trade truce lifted sentiment, with focus now on more developments around more trade deals.】

item.title: 消息人士称印度亿万富翁安巴尼将在多哈会见特朗普和卡塔尔埃米尔
item.description: 两位消息人士告诉路透社，印度亿万富翁穆克什-安巴尼（Mukesh Ambani）将于周三在多哈会见美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）和卡塔尔埃米尔，因为他的公司信实工业（Reliance Industries）希望促进与两国当局的关系。【原文：Indian billionaire Mukesh Ambani will meet U.S. President Donald Trump and the emir of Qatar in Doha on Wednesday, two sources told Reuters, as his company Reliance Industries looks to foster ties with authorities in both nations.】

item.title: 英国根据网络安全法调查色情网站运营商 Kick
item.description: 英国媒体监管机构 Ofcom 周三表示，已根据其网络安全法对色情网站运营商 Kick Online Entertainment S.A. 发起了两项调查。【原文：Britain's media regulator Ofcom has launched two investigations into pornography website operator Kick Online Entertainment S.A. under its online safety law, it said on Wednesday.】

item.title: Holcim 股东批准分拆北美业务
item.description: Holcim 股东周三批准了该水泥生产商北美业务的分离和分拆交易，该交易旨在从美国建筑支出的增长中获益。【原文：Holcim shareholders on Wednesday approved the separation and spinoff of the cement maker's North American business in a transaction designed to benefit from ramped up construction spending in the United States.】

item.title: 腾讯第一季度游戏收入增长 13
item.description: 受游戏业务增长的推动，中国市值最大的科技公司腾讯控股周三公布第一季度收入增长 13%。【原文：Tencent Holdings , China's biggest technology company by market capitalization, posted a 13% rise in first-quarter revenue on Wednesday, driven by growth in its gaming business.】

item.title: Fortress 设立阿布扎比办事处，任命地区主管，推动海湾地区增长
item.description: 美国堡垒投资集团（Fortress Investment Group）周三表示，该公司已在阿布扎比开设了办事处，并任命了一名高级管理人员，负责在海湾地区开展业务。【原文：Fortress Investment Group has opened an office in Abu Dhabi and appointed a senior executive to build its business in the Gulf region, the U.S. firm said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 工人罢工抗议德国福特公司裁员
item.description: 福特位于德国科隆市的两家汽车厂的工人周三举行罢工，抗议这家美国汽车制造商计划在欧洲裁员数千人。【原文：Workers at Ford's two car plants in the German city of Cologne went on strike on Wednesday, protesting thousands of planned job cuts across the U.S. automaker's European operations.】

item.title: 日本 SMFG 公布创纪录的年度利润，尽管第四季度业绩下滑
item.description: 日本第二大银行集团三井住友金融集团（Sumitomo Mitsui Financial Group）第四季度净利润下滑 75%，但由于日本企业贷款需求强劲，全年利润仍达到创纪录的 1.18 万亿日元。【原文：Japan's second-largest banking group Sumitomo Mitsui Financial Group posted a 75% slump in fourth-quarter net profit but still hit a record 1.18 trillion yen profit for the year on strong demand for loans among Japanese corporations.】

item.title: 中国表示将加快对科技创新的金融支持
item.description: 中国周三表示，将进一步加强资本市场对科技创新企业的支持，并扩大银行对科技创新企业的信贷支持。【原文：China said on Wednesday it would further enhance capital market support for science and technology innovation enterprises and would expand bank credit support for the firms.】

item.title: 出生率下降，意大利婴儿床制造商将目光投向老年人
item.description: 由于出生率连年下降和来自国外的竞争，许多小型家族企业被迫关闭，意大利北部曾经繁荣的婴幼儿产品工业区如今只剩下两家制造商。【原文：Only two manufacturers remain in northern Italy's once thriving industrial district for baby and child products, after years of falling births and competition from abroad forced many of the small-scale family-owned businesses to close.】

item.title: 美国食品药品管理局的动荡迫使一些生物技术公司计划在美国之外进行早期试验
item.description: 一些美国生物技术公司的高管、投资者和顾问告诉路透社，由于担心特朗普政府下的药品监管机构裁员和政策变化可能会推迟监管审查，他们正在考虑将新药的早期试验转移到美国境外。【原文：Some U.S. biotech companies are considering moving early-stage trials of new medicines outside the United States as worry grows that layoffs and policy changes at the drugs watchdog under the Trump administration may delay regulatory reviews, executives, investors, and consultants told Reuters.】

item.title: 欧盟法院宣布拒绝与辉瑞公司竞购欧盟冯德莱恩疫苗信息
item.description: 欧洲二审法院周三驳回了《纽约时报》对欧盟委员会提出的调阅欧盟委员会主席乌苏拉-冯-德莱恩（Ursula von der Leyen）与辉瑞公司首席执行官阿尔伯特-布尔拉（Albert Bourla）之间关于购买数十亿欧元 COVID-19 疫苗的短信的请求。【原文：Europe's second-top court on Wednesday dismissed the European Commission's rejection of a New York Times' request to access text messages between its President Ursula von der Leyen and Pfizer CEO Albert Bourla on the purchase of billions of euros of COVID-19 vaccines.】

item.title: 英国 Co-Op 公司称网络事件后系统运行正常
item.description: 英国 Co-Op 集团表示，其系统目前运行正常，从本周末开始，商店和网上的存货供应将得到改善，所有形式的支付都能正常进行，并提供了最近披露的网络事件的最新情况。【原文：Britain's Co-Op Group said its systems were now running normally and there would be improved stock availability in stores and online from this weekend, with all forms of payments working, providing an update on a recently-disclosed cyber incident.】

item.title: AgResource 称，若无中国贸易协议，美国大豆出口或将下降 20
item.description: 农业综合企业咨询公司AgResource周三表示，如果美国和中国未能就限制美国大豆进入其最大市场的贸易争端达成协议，美国大豆出口量可能会下降20%，支付给农民的价格也将暴跌。【原文：U.S. soybean exports may drop 20% and the prices paid to farmers will plunge if the United States and China fail to reach a deal in their trade dispute limiting U.S. soybeans from its largest market, agribusiness consultants AgResource said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 巴基斯坦中央银行称，巴基斯坦收到国际货币基金组织（IMF）扩大基金机制的第二笔付款
item.description: 巴基斯坦中央银行周三在 X 上发帖称，巴基斯坦已收到国际货币基金组织根据扩大基金贷款计划提供的第二批特别提款权，价值 7.6 亿美元（10.23 亿美元）。【原文：Pakistan has received the second tranche of special drawing rights worth 760 million ($1,023 million) from the International Monetary Fund under the extended fund facility programme, the country's central bank said in a post on X on Wednesday.】
